abstract: The audio channel layout tag of the audio sample buffers produced by the audio data output.
overview:
## Discussion

When you set your audio data output’s associated [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDeviceInput/multichannelAudioMode] property to `AVCaptureMultichannelAudioModeFirstOrderAmbisonics`, the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession] allows up to two [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput] instances to be connected to the First-order Ambisonsics (FOA) input. If you connect a single [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput] instance, you must configure its [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput/spatialAudioChannelLayoutTag] property to produce either four channels of FOA audio or two channels of Stereo audio. If you connect two [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput] instances, you must configure one to output four channels of FOA audio and the other to output two channels of Stereo audio.

Thus, when you set your associated [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDeviceInput/multichannelAudioMode] property to `AVCaptureMultichannelAudioModeFirstOrderAmbisonics`, you must set your connected [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput] instance’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput/spatialAudioChannelLayoutTag] property to either `kAudioChannelLayoutTag_Stereo` for stereo, or `(kAudioChannelLayoutTag_HOA_ACN_SN3D | 4)` for FOA (see [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreAudioTypes/AudioChannelLayoutTag]). When you set your associated [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDeviceInput/multichannelAudioMode] to any other value, the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession] only supports one [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput], and you may only set [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput/spatialAudioChannelLayoutTag] to `kAudioChannelLayoutTag_Unknown` (the default value).

Your [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession] validates your app’s adherence to the the above rules when you call `AVCaptureSession/startRunning:` or [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession/commitConfiguration()] and throws a `NSInvalidArgumentException` if necessary.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput/spatialAudioChannelLayoutTag

# spatialAudioChannelLayoutTag

**Instance Property**

The audio channel layout tag of the audio sample buffers produced by the audio data output.

## Declaration

```swift
var spatialAudioChannelLayoutTag: AudioChannelLayoutTag { get set }
```

## Discussion

When you set your audio data output’s associated [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDeviceInput/multichannelAudioMode] property to `AVCaptureMultichannelAudioModeFirstOrderAmbisonics`, the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession] allows up to two [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput] instances to be connected to the First-order Ambisonsics (FOA) input. If you connect a single [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput] instance, you must configure its [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput/spatialAudioChannelLayoutTag] property to produce either four channels of FOA audio or two channels of Stereo audio. If you connect two [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput] instances, you must configure one to output four channels of FOA audio and the other to output two channels of Stereo audio.

Thus, when you set your associated [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDeviceInput/multichannelAudioMode] property to `AVCaptureMultichannelAudioModeFirstOrderAmbisonics`, you must set your connected [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput] instance’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput/spatialAudioChannelLayoutTag] property to either `kAudioChannelLayoutTag_Stereo` for stereo, or `(kAudioChannelLayoutTag_HOA_ACN_SN3D | 4)` for FOA (see [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreAudioTypes/AudioChannelLayoutTag]). When you set your associated [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDeviceInput/multichannelAudioMode] to any other value, the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession] only supports one [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput], and you may only set [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureAudioDataOutput/spatialAudioChannelLayoutTag] to `kAudioChannelLayoutTag_Unknown` (the default value).

Your [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession] validates your app’s adherence to the the above rules when you call `AVCaptureSession/startRunning:` or [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession/commitConfiguration()] and throws a `NSInvalidArgumentException` if necessary.

## Configuring audio capture

- **audioSettings**: The settings used to decode or re-encode audio before it’s output.
- **recommendedAudioSettingsForAssetWriter(writingTo:)**: Specifies the recommended settings for use with an `AVAssetWriterInput`.
